devdoc.author: TobowerTheGreatAxios
devdoc.details: This smart contract is the core battle logic and reveal for the game*

battle(address,bytes32,uint256,bytes32,u.details: The Battle FunctionChecks Both the Signer and the Opponent for ItemsTakes the bytes32 hash and uses it with token ids to match items for a full return on both endsEmits an Event With all the data as well?

commitItem(bytes32).details: Enables Player to Commit an Item

params.commitment: Takes a hashed commit and stores on chain

constructor.details: Sets Game Item Contract to the active Game ItemsScript MUST add WIN_MANAGER_ROLE to THIS

getCommitment(address).details: Gets Current Commitment of a Player

getGameItemContract().details: Gets Address of The Game Item Contract

getRecord(address).details: Retrieves Record for a playerReturns the record in the format Wins-Losses-Draws-BATTLES with each value being uint256 due to mappipng setup

params.player: the address of the player that the record is for

BattleCompleted(address,address,uint8,ui.notice: Emits the End of a Battle

getRecord(address).notice: Depending on our thoughts here, although on SKALE it does not matter, we could look to lower the maximum win-loss-draw size as the uint256 size may be much larger than required
